data.what_is:
SuprSend is a powerful notification infrastructure that streamlines your product notifications with an API-first approach. Create and deliver transactional, crons, and engagement notifications on multiple channels with a single notification API.

What you get with SuprSend?

- Multi-tenant support for easy client management
- Template management with version controls
- In-App Inbox for website and app (React, Angular, JS, Flutter - embedded & Headless components)
- SMS, Email, Slack, Teams, WhatsApp, Mobile & web push integration
- Batching notifications & Digests
- Routing notifications between multiple channels
- Brand management to send notifications to customer's end users
- Out-of-the-box user preference management
- Vendor fallback, switch with auto-intelligent routing
- Run campaigns on top of the data warehouse
- Real-time logs, analytics, and failure alerts

Try for free: https://app.suprsend.com/en/signup/ 

Built for: # Startups (0-1) # Scaling Startups with Infra needs # B2B2C, B2B & B2C Companies # Enterprises with Enterprise Grade features & security. Send workflow-triggered notifications via single API integration to multiple channels.
data.product_description: SuprSend is a powerful notification infrastructure to help companies set up, manage and scale product notifications across all channels. It provides developers and product managers with a centralized location to manage vendors, templates, analytics, and logs. And helps them to construct meaningful notifications no matter how complex - thereby enhancing the customer experience without the need for extensive in-house development.
data.supported_languages: German, English, French, Japanese, Russian, Spanish, Chinese (Simplified)

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to setup solution which provides all requires features
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
- We have been using SuprSend for more than 7 months and didn't face any issues as we scaled and started sending more notifications.
- I was working on integrating Suprsend with our backend and was able to complete the integration in just 2 days. The incremental effort to add a new notification is very less.
- It provides lot of features like user notification preferences, throttling, webhooks for email events.
- Both Nikita and Gaurav are very prompt in answering any queries and fixing any issues that we face.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
- Logging infrastructure can be improved to support more analytics.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use SuprSend to
- send notifications to our customers. We support work management, billing and invoice, proposals in our product. We send our users notifications related to our change
- send notifications to clients of our customers. Our customers use our product to interact with their client - sending proposal, invoices, raising client requests/forms etc.

initial_reviews.review_title: Advanced notification system from get go
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
Everything you need to build customer-first notifications is provided out-of-the-box. We are able to improve notification experiences with ease.

We use their workflow engine, preferences and notification center.
Platform is easy to integrate and test, and is extremely stable.

Developer documentation and support is top notch.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
There are many concepts (as it is an infra layer). But once you understand them, they all fit in like building blocks, and you can design any complex notification usecase with ease.

SDK for Ruby on Rails is not there, but we ended up consuming their APIs directly.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending customer centric notifications was an important part of our product experience. SuprSend has provided us with multi-channels, templates out of code, batching, preferences, and notification center.
We are leveraging all the capabilities one by one, without having to do development at out end.

initial_reviews.review_title: Powerful abstraction layer for notifications
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
The fact that developers just need to call one API and then build notification logic, templates, and configure channels on SuprSend, instead of in code, was much needed abstraction for the mess notifications created in code.
On top of APIs and dashboard, SuprSend also provides embeddable components that we can just drop in our website, and adjust to our designs, and we are good to go.
Documentation is neat, support is really good, and logs are very helpful. Implementation was smooth.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
For now, all of our usecases get solved. We would like to see user segmentation capability, so we can centralize our marketing notifications too.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
We knew of the challenges notifications become from our first project. So we decided to build on third party form the start. It saves tons of development effort, increases visiblity, accelerates time to market and what not. Will 100% recommend using SuprSend for managing notifications.

initial_reviews.review_title: Most Promising and Leading Notification Platform
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
1. Event based notification architecture decoupling workflow executions from event source.
2. Multiple notification channel management in one place
3. Inbox experience out of the box
4. Super supportive post sales support
5. There costs are very competitive.
6. Ease of implementation
7. Analytics available on the platform itself.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
None that I am aware of at the moment. All good

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
1.  A quick out-of-the-box inbox experience improved our customer experience.
2. All multichannel vendor management comes in one place.
3. Backend infra is freed from managing all of this ourselves.
4. We just push notifications to one of our AWS topic and our customers get it 100%.

initial_reviews.review_title: Powerful NaaS platform for personalized notifications
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
We've been using SuprSend for the past few months to manage our multi-channel notification system, and we're impressed!

Suprsend has been a game-changer for managing notifications. We used to juggle different platforms for email, Slack, etc.

Now everything is under one roof, making it much easier to create, schedule, and track notifications.

Would recommend to other businesses? Absolutely!

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
While SuprSend is user-friendly overall, there was a slight learning curve initially for our team to get familiar with all the features and functionalities.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us manage all our notifications under one roof and makes it easy to keep track of all of them. Their customization and personalization functionalities are also super helpful!

2) Stable & reliable product that works
3) Quick support from the team

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
They currently miss support for notification analytics at tenant level on their dashboard, though we can get it synced to our DB.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?

initial_reviews.review_title: Their templating engine is a super power for product teams
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
I really like their intuitive template engine, which is unified for all channels, and can handle complex logic too (loops, conditions). Moreover, there is versioning support so we can trace each and every change in templates and run experiments very easily. We also get a central repository of all channels at one place.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
Would like it if we could configure chat based responses to incoming messages on Whatsapp. Right now, we have built it in our code where we get responses via webhook from SuprSend and then write logic in code. If it was solved on SuprSend's platform it would have saved us that time and effort.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Building and updating templates for different channels was simplified very much with SuprSend. Earlier we used to create every template through coding, which wasn't very ideal way as it took control from product teams. Moreover, to update any template with any kind of additional information we had to do it individually for each channel. Certainly not a very apt method for us. SuprSend's unified API solved this problem, as dependency on code is to just trigger the business event, and the product team manages the templates on all the channels. They have built a wonderful communication tool for companies of all size

initial_reviews.review_title: Best in class preference management module
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
Us being a management tool for schools, meant that there were a lot of notifications going out to our customers. Now as we solve for multiple use cases and have too many modules, there were naturally a lot of different types of notifications with varying degree of importance too. Our customers were requesting for a preference management solution so they could unsubscribe from notifications they didn't find important. There were also requests for sending a few notifications immediately and others as digests. SuprSend's inbox notifications along with preference management system provided us with a quick go-to-market solution without writing code. We compared SuprSend with other tools, and some of them were missing multi-tenant notification preferences, and others were providing only APIs, we fould only SuprSend's solution to be complete.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
Nothing as such, we got things delivered as promised. A little delay was there then the original estimated time, though it was still very quick.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Their preference management solution is of top-notch quality. Our customers, their internal and external stakeholders can opt-in / opt-out of notifications from a simple UI, making it a strong value prop for our product.

initial_reviews.review_title: Template approval got faster and easier with SuprSend automation
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
The automated template approval process provided by SuprSend has been a huge time-saver for us. Previously, we had to manually approve each template, which was time-consuming and often led to delays in our notification process. With this feature, templates are automatically approved, which has greatly streamlined our workflow.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
The only minor downside is that we had to spend some time configuring the system to meet our specific needs.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
The automated template approval process is solving the problem of manual approval that we were facing with our previous system. With this feature, we can now send notifications more quickly and efficiently, without the need for time-consuming manual approvals. This has helped us to improve our overall notification process and has allowed us to be more responsive to our users' needs. Additionally, this feature has freed up time for our team to focus on other critical tasks, which is a major benefit in a fast-paced environment like ours.

SuprSend's visibility feature is a god-send with real time tracking and visibility. From a single platform, our team can easily check the notification logs along with any errors if any.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
I wish SuprSend had a more user-friendly interface for setting up notifications. It can be a bit confusing at first, and it took us some time to get everything set up the way we wanted it. But once we got the hang of it, it's been smooth sailing.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of our biggest challenges at our organisation was keeping track of all the different channels we use to communicate with our customers. With SuprSend, we can easily manage all of our notifications in one place, without having to worry about manually monitoring each channel. This has saved us a ton of time and hassle, and has allowed us to focus more on improving our product and customer experience.

We have a lot of customers, and we send notifications to our customers (including admins and employees) and their third party stakeholders. They by-default need a white-labelled solution. And requirement of customization and therefore margin of error in handling multi-tenant templating systems in code is very high. That's why we went ahead with SuprSend becuase their multi-tenancy feature was one of the most matured functionality among other similar tools. And everything is available on front-end, so chances of error in visual elements is lower too.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
Robust multi-tenant functionality is present, it's enough for our use-case currently. It takes a bit of learning curve to know all the offerings they have, but once you use the platform it becomes easy.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
While comparing with other similar providers during our internal benchmarking phase, we came across few more tools. They were good, but we went ahead with SuprSend becuase of their matured multi-tenant functionality as compared to the other two.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to setup solution which provides all requires features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
- We have been using SuprSend for more than 7 months and didn't face any issues as we scaled and started sending more notifications.
- I was working on integrating Suprsend with our backend and was able to complete the integration in just 2 days. The incremental effort to add a new notification is very less.
- It provides lot of features like user notification preferences, throttling, webhooks for email events.
- Both Nikita and Gaurav are very prompt in answering any queries and fixing any issues that we face.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
- Logging infrastructure can be improved to support more analytics.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use SuprSend to
- send notifications to our customers. We support work management, billing and invoice, proposals in our product. We send our users notifications related to our change
- send notifications to clients of our customers. Our customers use our product to interact with their client - sending proposal, invoices, raising client requests/forms etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Advanced notification system from get go
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
Everything you need to build customer-first notifications is provided out-of-the-box. We are able to improve notification experiences with ease.

We use their workflow engine, preferences and notification center.
Platform is easy to integrate and test, and is extremely stable.

Developer documentation and support is top notch.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
There are many concepts (as it is an infra layer). But once you understand them, they all fit in like building blocks, and you can design any complex notification usecase with ease.

SDK for Ruby on Rails is not there, but we ended up consuming their APIs directly.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending customer centric notifications was an important part of our product experience. SuprSend has provided us with multi-channels, templates out of code, batching, preferences, and notification center.
We are leveraging all the capabilities one by one, without having to do development at out end.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful abstraction layer for notifications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
The fact that developers just need to call one API and then build notification logic, templates, and configure channels on SuprSend, instead of in code, was much needed abstraction for the mess notifications created in code.
On top of APIs and dashboard, SuprSend also provides embeddable components that we can just drop in our website, and adjust to our designs, and we are good to go.
Documentation is neat, support is really good, and logs are very helpful. Implementation was smooth.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
For now, all of our usecases get solved. We would like to see user segmentation capability, so we can centralize our marketing notifications too.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
We knew of the challenges notifications become from our first project. So we decided to build on third party form the start. It saves tons of development effort, increases visiblity, accelerates time to market and what not. Will 100% recommend using SuprSend for managing notifications.

We've been using SuprSend for the past few months to manage our multi-channel notification system, and we're impressed!

Suprsend has been a game-changer for managing notifications. We used to juggle different platforms for email, Slack, etc.

Now everything is under one roof, making it much easier to create, schedule, and track notifications.

It helps us manage all our notifications under one roof and makes it easy to keep track of all of them. Their customization and personalization functionalities are also super helpful!

all_reviews.review_title: Best platform to manage notifications across multiple channels & tenants
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
1) Centralize notifications across email, slack, teams, in-app
2) Stable & reliable product that works
3) Quick support from the team

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
They currently miss support for notification analytics at tenant level on their dashboard, though we can get it synced to our DB.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having a multiple org-user based structure required us to create multiple tenant notifications, and across email, slack, teams, inbox. It is definitely a time-intensive exercise for our devs team. SuprSend saved much of that pain, providing us quick time to market. Product team is now in control of managing notifications. A well designed product that will work for future usecases too.

all_reviews.review_title: Their templating engine is a super power for product teams
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
I really like their intuitive template engine, which is unified for all channels, and can handle complex logic too (loops, conditions). Moreover, there is versioning support so we can trace each and every change in templates and run experiments very easily. We also get a central repository of all channels at one place.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
Would like it if we could configure chat based responses to incoming messages on Whatsapp. Right now, we have built it in our code where we get responses via webhook from SuprSend and then write logic in code. If it was solved on SuprSend's platform it would have saved us that time and effort.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Building and updating templates for different channels was simplified very much with SuprSend. Earlier we used to create every template through coding, which wasn't very ideal way as it took control from product teams. Moreover, to update any template with any kind of additional information we had to do it individually for each channel. Certainly not a very apt method for us. SuprSend's unified API solved this problem, as dependency on code is to just trigger the business event, and the product team manages the templates on all the channels. They have built a wonderful communication tool for companies of all size

all_reviews.review_title: Best in class preference management module
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
Us being a management tool for schools, meant that there were a lot of notifications going out to our customers. Now as we solve for multiple use cases and have too many modules, there were naturally a lot of different types of notifications with varying degree of importance too. Our customers were requesting for a preference management solution so they could unsubscribe from notifications they didn't find important. There were also requests for sending a few notifications immediately and others as digests. SuprSend's inbox notifications along with preference management system provided us with a quick go-to-market solution without writing code. We compared SuprSend with other tools, and some of them were missing multi-tenant notification preferences, and others were providing only APIs, we fould only SuprSend's solution to be complete.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
Nothing as such, we got things delivered as promised. A little delay was there then the original estimated time, though it was still very quick.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Their preference management solution is of top-notch quality. Our customers, their internal and external stakeholders can opt-in / opt-out of notifications from a simple UI, making it a strong value prop for our product.

all_reviews.review_title: Template approval got faster and easier with SuprSend automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
The automated template approval process provided by SuprSend has been a huge time-saver for us. Previously, we had to manually approve each template, which was time-consuming and often led to delays in our notification process. With this feature, templates are automatically approved, which has greatly streamlined our workflow.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
The only minor downside is that we had to spend some time configuring the system to meet our specific needs.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
The automated template approval process is solving the problem of manual approval that we were facing with our previous system. With this feature, we can now send notifications more quickly and efficiently, without the need for time-consuming manual approvals. This has helped us to improve our overall notification process and has allowed us to be more responsive to our users' needs. Additionally, this feature has freed up time for our team to focus on other critical tasks, which is a major benefit in a fast-paced environment like ours.

With SuprSend, we can easily manage all of our notifications in one place, without having to worry about manually monitoring each channel. This has saved us a ton of time and hassle, and has allowed us to focus more on improving our product and customer experience.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
As we rapidly added new users to our platform, we were experiencing a new phenomenon of encountering diverse use cases for notifying them about specific things. Since coding it in our notifications would have made it less flexible for product managers, we decided to ship with SuprSend's notification stack. My team created multiple workflows just in hours, and the best part, they got deployed successfully, with very little devs involvement.

And requirement of customization and therefore margin of error in handling multi-tenant templating systems in code is very high. That's why we went ahead with SuprSend becuase their multi-tenancy feature was one of the most matured functionality among other similar tools. review_question_answers.question: What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We have a lot of notifications across multiple channels. We had built our own notification engine, and it was demanding a lot of features constantly. So we decided to build our notification engine on SuprSend. Creating notifications now and experimenting with them is very quick now, and it has freed up a lot of our dev's time. Another thing is the platform's ability to handle channel routing and vendor fallbacks. We have had instances in the past where our notifications failed and we were left scrambling to get it back up and running. With SuprSend, we no longer have to worry about such instances.

all_reviews.review_title: Best notification tool for marketplace
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
SuprSend has been a game-changer for us. As a marketplace that is scaling quickly, we were struggling to keep up with the complexity of our notifications, especially managing many different types of workflows. But with SuprSend, all that has changed. Our notification systems are now streamlined and more manageable, saving us valuable time and effort.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
There's not much to dislike. The integration process was seamless and the SuprSend team was always available to help us with any questions we had.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
SuprSend's flexible app inbox and vendor fallback feature have been particularly useful for us. As a marketplace, we rely heavily on timely notifying influencers and companies with each other's activities. SuprSend has made these communications quite good with batching and channel routing, giving us the peace of mind that our notifications will always reach their intended recipients on right channel at right frequency. Plus, their documentation is easy to follow and their support team is quick to respond. All in all, we're really happy with our decision to work with SuprSend.

I'd highly recommend SuprSend to any marketplace company looking to streamline their notification process.

We originally had email notifications, but there was a constant customer request to add new channels. We decided to go for slack and app inbox notification channel, which got added in just 1 day. We created workflows, segmented users on queries, their template engine was robust, integrated our providers using the API key, and ran messages in sync with other channel.

Nothing specific, the product is well made. Frequent developments are going with feature requests, but that's with every startup.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
Adding new channels in our initial notification module was sort of not our focus, as our product was scaling and needed our efforts there. Hence we were looking for a plug-and-play tool, which could basically do these tasks with a fallback mechanism in place. Needless to say, the ease of administration for SuprSend made overall work easier for our development team.

all_reviews.review_title: Effortless and powerful notification infrastructure!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
Quite a lot of things to like about Suprsend!

1. One of the only players to serve the B2B2C market where one can customise the templates with branding (logo, domain name, etc.)
2. Super simple integration and fast go live
3. Advanced notification experience e.g. grouping
4. Super useful in no code experiments using tools like Webflow (trigger via Zapier!)
5. User preferences management
6. Amazing highly committed team!

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
There really isn't much to dislike but more customisations in the data reporting dashboard will be helpful for PMs to track performance.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
SuprSend takes over the headache of building, managing and scaling your notification infrastructure (e.g. transaction confirmations, critical updates, etc.) while helping take a clear step jump in terms of the notification experience for end users!

all_reviews.review_title: I recently started using SuprSend for my product notification infrastructure. Makes things easy.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
SuprSend is super easy to use. Even though I'm not a tech-savvy person, I was able to quickly get the hang of it. The setup process was a breeze and the user interface is clear and intuitive. I also appreciate the helpful customer support team who are always quick to respond and easily able to help me out with any issues I have.

The features of SuprSend are really great. It's great to have the flexibility to customize notifications and set up automated emails. I've found that the automated emails are really effective in helping me reach my target audience.

All in all, I'm really happy with SuprSend. It's been a great help in improving my product's notification infrastructure, and I would definitely recommend it to other businesses.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
They are in starting phase currently, and hence the product features are being added continuously. Although the team is very supportive, especially Gaurav who helped us setup our stack right from beginning. For anyone, looking to bring in the notification stack, contact Gaurav, he'll be very helpful during scale-up.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
SuprSend is an amazing B2B SaaS software that provides an innovative notification infrastructure for products. It allows companies to send notifications to their customers quickly and efficiently. The platform is incredibly easy to use, with a user-friendly interface, and offers great features such as custom templates, triggers and APIs to help companies automate their notification processes.

SuprSend has been a great help to companies in the product notification space. Previously, companies had to manually send notifications to customers, which was a time-consuming and labor-intensive process. all_reviews.review_title: Awesome no-code for notification infrastructure stack
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
We got up and running with our notifications in less than 2 hours. The ability to A/B test with templates without a single line of code is awesome. The analytics dashboard for tracking the efficacy of the notifications is also very effective.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
The platform can have some more channel integrations, although, the ones we were looking for were non-standard. We were able to integrate SMS, Whatsapp, Push and Email seamlessly. We wanted to integrate Telegram and Discord as well. It would be good to have these channels in the future.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Almost a no-code stack to setup the notification system, which gets a company up and running with user communications very quickly.
- A lot more control for the product managers to A/B test with notifications without any developer dependency. We always felt this is how notifications should have been done all along.

all_reviews.review_title: Notifications/User communications architecture solved once and for all!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuprSend?
1. If you want to build the right notification architecture for your platform, it can be a very time-consuming and resource-heavy project. SuprSend is simply plug and play. Also, you don't need to worry about scaling at peaks.
2. Able to run AB experiments with notification content without tech intervention
3. Finally able to avoid spamming users.  Most orgs tend to use all channels each time they want to notify users. Here you can define the mandatory channels and the system automatically decides on other channels only if the user has not seen the notification in mandatory channels. Amazing for cost optimisation at scale and to avoid spamming.
4. The team is extremely responsive. We were able to create a slack group for them and it's so easy to reach out, and schedule calls in real-time with them whenever needed.

I can't stress this one enough but ZERO/minimal tech dependency is so powerful for our product managers and content team. Design and send transactional notifications, run experiments and so on.

What do you dislike about SuprSend?
I'm in love with this product so much that I'm becoming greedy for features. Would love for it to have DB connectors, telegram integrations and so on. I know it's in their roadmap though.

What problems is SuprSend solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Notifications architecture scaling (both in terms of infrastructure and human resources)
2. AB testing notifications content without tech dependency
3. Avoid spamming users (Suprsend figures out channels based on user behaviour and you can define mandatory channels if needed)
4. WYSIWYG transactional notifications design
